*Before attempting these questions, it is highly recommended that you read [Guide: Introduction to algebraic fractions](../studyguides/introtoalgebraicfractions.qmd).*

## Q1 {.unnumbered}

For each algebraic fraction, state the restriction(s) on the denominator (the value(s) of $x$ for which the fraction is undefined).

1.1. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{3}{x}$

1.2. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{5}{x-4}$

1.3. $\displaystyle \quad -\dfrac{2}{2x+1}$

1.4. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x+3}{x+5}$

1.5. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{4x}{x(3x-2)}$

1.6. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x-1}{(x+2)(x-3)}$

1.7. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{5x+1}{x^2-16}$

1.8. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{2}{(x-1)^2}$

1.9. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x}{x^2+4x}$

1.10. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{7}{(x+3)(2x-5)}$

1.11. $\displaystyle \quad -\dfrac{x-4}{x^2-5x+6}$

1.12. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{2x+3}{x^2+2x-8}$

## Q2 {.unnumbered}

Find the missing value $?$ that makes the two algebraic fractions equivalent.

2.1. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x}{3} = \dfrac{?}{9}$

2.2. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{2}{x} = \dfrac{10}{?}$

2.3. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x+1}{4} = \dfrac{?}{12}$

2.4. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{3x}{5} = \dfrac{?}{20}$

2.5. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{5}{x+2} = \dfrac{?}{2(x+2)}$

2.6. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x-3}{x} = \dfrac{?}{2x}$

2.7. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{4}{x-1} = \dfrac{12}{?}$

2.8. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x}{x-4} = \dfrac{?}{3(x-4)}$

2.9. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x+5}{2x} = \dfrac{3(x+5)}{?}$

2.10. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{2x-1}{x+3} = \dfrac{?}{3(x+3)}$

2.11. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{3}{x} = \dfrac{3(x+1)}{?}$

2.12. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x}{x-2} = \dfrac{x(x+3)}{?}$

2.13. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{4x}{x+1} = \dfrac{?}{(x+1)^2}$

2.14. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{2x+1}{x-5} = \dfrac{6x+3}{?}$

2.15. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{5-x}{x+2} = \dfrac{?}{-2(x+2)}$

## Q3 {.unnumbered}

Simplify each algebraic fraction.

3.1. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{8x}{12x}$

3.2. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{5x^2}{15x}$

3.3. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x^2+4x}{x}$

3.4. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{3x^2-9x}{6x}$

3.5. $\displaystyle \quad -\dfrac{4x}{10x}$

3.6. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x^2-16}{x-4}$

3.7. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x^2-1}{x+1}$

3.8. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x^2+5x+6}{x+2}$

3.9. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x^2+3x-10}{x-2}$

3.10. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{2x^2+7x+3}{x+3}$

3.11. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x^2-10x+25}{x-5}$

3.12. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{4-x}{x-4}$

3.13. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{2x^2-8}{x^2-4}$

3.14. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x^3-4x}{x^2-4}$

3.15. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{x^2-3x-10}{x^2-25}$
